greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Consider the n X n matrix with entries (i*j mod n), where i,j=0..n-1; a(n) = rank of this matrix over the real numbers.
formula: Let n = Prod_{i>0} p_i^{m_i} be the prime factorization of n. Then a(n) = floor((n + 1)/2) + Prod_{i>0} (m_i + 1) - 2. - _Alexander Adam_, Nov 10 2012
example: Let p >= 3 be a prime number. Then a(p^m) = (p^m + 1) / 2 + m - 1.
mathematica: a[n_] := MatrixRank[Table[Table[Mod[i * j, n], {j, 0, n - 1}], {i, 0, n - 1}]]; Array[a,100] (* _Alexander Adam_, Nov 10 2012 *)
results.author: _Max Alekseyev_, Dec 01 2003
